intro: Cyclosorus paucipinnatus, commonly known as the narrow-pinnate water fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are divided into several narrow, thread-like segments. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches. Its reproductive structures, including spore-producing sorus, are located on the undersides of its leaves. Cyclosorus paucipinnatus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
